body:
I just double checked using the following SQL query

```SQL
select  OBJECT_NAME(object_id) as table_name,* from sys.periods
```

that the columns for `start` and `end` are swapped in the database.

migrations model differ is not aware of the period start/end annotations, and when figuring out renames it just looks at the names (and property mappings, but those are the same). It so happens that old names were in different order ("End", "Start") than the new ones ("From", "To"). 

Workaround is to rename one column at a time.

Thanks for having looked into it. This is definitely not a satisfying workaround for such a task, but at the very least, it does the trick.
Naming the columns the right way in the first place does not create any issue, I just hope that a fix for this strange behavior can find its way to v.7.0

issue.title: Migrations are too aggressive on RenameColumn

milestone.title: Backlog

type.name: Feature

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
We made huge refactoring of our model for a new application.  There is a lot of RenameColumn in the generated Migration and a lot of them don't make sense: Foreign keys have been removed and added to different tables and EF Core choose to rename columns even when the foreign key is for a different table.

If we drop EntityAId (pointing to EntityA) and add EntityBId (pointing to EntityB), it shouldn't be a rename but a drop and add.

I think it should be a DropColumn and a AddColumn instead of a RenameColumn for a foreign key that points to different entities.

body: Note for triage: root cause is tracked by #15178. We should consider raising the priority of this.
Note from triage: at least try to fix this issue in 8.0, even if we don't get to all of https://github.com/dotnet/efcore/issues/15178.

issue.title: Fix to #29902 - Renaming PeriodStart and PeriodEnd columns of a temporal table causes them to be swapped

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Problem was that migration model differ was too lax with pairing up columns. Fix is to add more predicates - one that matches annotations+values and one that just matches annotations, ignoring the values, before we fallback to simple column definition. Now that we reworked temporal annotations, this actually gives clean match for the period start and period end column. Moreover, this change could improve matching in other, non-temporal scenarios.

Fixes #29902

issue.title: Renaming TemporalTable PeriodStart/PeriodEnd maps to incorrect value
